questions.question: Which of the following sentences has the correct punctuation?

choices.answer: At the grocery store, I bought apples oranges and bananas.
At the grocery store I bought apples, oranges, and bananas.
At the grocery store, I bought apples, oranges, and bananas.
At the grocery store: I bought apples, oranges, and bananas.

questions.question: Which of the following sentences has the correct punctuation?

choices.answer: The jury finally reached its verdict; guilty.
The jury finally reached its verdict: guilty.
The jury finally reached it's verdict: guilty.
The jury finally reached its verdict guilty.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a use for a colon?

choices.answer: Between clauses involving conjunctions.
Ratios
Introducing a list
Emphasis

questions.question: I would use a comma to join clauses together in a sentence if the sentence contained a _______.

choices.answer: Verb
Pronoun
Colon
Conjunction

questions.question: Which of the following sentences has the correct punctuation?

choices.answer: Yesterday was my birthday tomorrow is your birthday.
Yesterday was my birthday, tomorrow is your birthday.
Yesterday was my birthday; tomorrow is your birthday.
Yesterday was my birthday: tomorrow is your birthday.

questions.question: Which of the following sentences has the correct punctuation?

choices.answer: The ambulance drove by, and its siren was very loud.
The ambulance drove by; and its siren was very loud.
The ambulance drove by, and it's siren was very loud.
The ambulance drove by and its siren was very loud.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a use for commas?

choices.answer: When we need to pause in a sentence.
Talking to or about someone.
To separate a list of 3 items
To separate a list of 2 items

questions.question: True or false: Commas are used to enclose sub-clauses within a sentence.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Which of the following sentences does NOT have the correct punctuation?

choices.answer: Her favorite colors are blue and yellow.
Her favorite colors are blue, and yellow.
Her favorite colors are red, blue, and yellow.
Her favorite colors are red and yellow.

questions.question: Which of the following sentences has the correct punctuation?

choices.answer: My friend; even though he's very smart, failed the exam.
My friend, even though hes very smart, failed the exam.
My friend, even though he's very smart, failed the exam.
My friend even though he's very smart, failed the exam.

questions.question: Which of the following punctuation marks is used when introducing a list of items?

choices.answer: Colon
Semicolon
Comma
Apostrophe

questions.question: Which of the following is a use for commas within a sentence?

choices.answer: Separating adjectives
Separating pronouns
Linking clauses without a conjunction
Ratios

questions.question: Which of the following sentences has the correct punctuation?

choices.answer: I have three pets which include: a dog, a cat, and a bird.
I have three pets: a dog a cat and a bird.
I have three pets which include a dog a cat and a bird.
I have three pets: a dog, a cat, and a bird.

questions.question: Which of the following sentences does NOT have the correct punctuation?

choices.answer: The big, tall, strong man made a tackle during the game.
The intelligent, anxious, fearful student was late to class.
The nice, beautiful, caring woman held her crying child.
The old slow confused man was driving the wrong way.

questions.question: Which of the following sentences has the correct punctuation?

choices.answer: Hiroshima, a city in Japan, was destroyed on August 6 1945.
Hiroshima a city in Japan was destroyed on August 6, 1945.
Hiroshima, a city in Japan, was destroyed on August 6, 1945.
Hiroshima, a city in Japan, was destroyed on August, 6 1945.
